SEARCH
Package ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello

Class OthelloControllerHumanVSRandom

java.lang.Object
ca.utoronto.utm.assignment1.othello.OthelloControllerHumanVSRandom
public class OthelloControllerHumanVSRandom extends Object
This controller uses the Model classes to allow the Human player P1 to play the computer P2. The computer, P2 uses a random strategy.

  • Constructor Details

    • OthelloControllerHumanVSRandom

      public OthelloControllerHumanVSRandom(Othello othello, PlayerHuman player1, PlayerRandom player2)
      Run main to play a Human (P1) against the computer P2. The computer uses a random strategy, that is, it randomly picks one of its possible moves. The output should be almost identical to that of OthelloControllerHumanVSHuman. Constructs a new OthelloControllerHumanVSRandom with the specified Othello game instance and player instances.
      Parameters:
      othello - the Othello game instance this controller manages
      player1 - the human player
      player2 - the player using random strategy

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method to run the game, allowing a human player to play against a computer player that selects moves randomly.
      Parameters:
      args -

    • play

      public char play()
      Manages the gameplay loop, alternating turns between the two players until the game is over. Reports the current state of the game, handles player moves, and determines the winner.
      Returns:
      the character representing the winner of the game ('X' for P1, 'O' for P2)

    • reportMove

      protected void reportMove(char whosTurn, Move move)
      Reports the move made by a player, including the player's identifier and the move's coordinates.
      Parameters:
      whosTurn - the character representing the player making the move
      move - the move that was made by the player

    • report

      protected void report()
      Reports the current state of the game, including the board layout, player scores, and the current player's turn.

    • reportFinal

      protected void reportFinal()
      Reports the final state of the game, including the board layout, player scores, and the winner.
